title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 11 May 2015 - XWiki
content:
<Slashman> has quit  
02:31 <SplitIce> has joined #xwiki  
02:32 <SplitIce> Has anyone here successfully compiled XWiki? Been trying for a few hours to do so in IntelliJ (IDEA).  
02:32 <SplitIce> Error:(24, 21) java: cannot find symbol symbol:   class XWikiContext location: package com.xpn.xwiki  
02:32 <SplitIce> in xwiki-platform\xwiki-platform-core\xwiki-platform-zipexplorer\src\main\java\com\xpn\xwiki\plugin\zipexplorer\ZipExplorerPluginAPI.java  
02:34 <SplitIce> Might be something because I am fairly new (~6mo) to Java as a platform.  
02:34 <SplitIce> \*something simple

11:39 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
11:54 <Enygma`> has joined #xwiki  
11:57 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
12:01 <DarkKnightCZ> mflorea: hi, XWIKI-11985 is still broken if you use something else except document entity (for example space and possibly even wiki entity if it can be used), I narrowed it down to evaluate macro in getPath macro in DocumentTreeMacros (getDocumentPath returns only documents, not spaces, which results in broken opening, since it cannot find root element)  
12:07 <mflorea> DarkKnightCZ: I've seen your message last week, and I asked you to give me a tree macro usage example that reproduces the problem (ideally on a clean XWiki install).  
12:08 <DarkKnightCZ> mflorea: great, i thought my connection broke so i wasn't sure if you read that... just a second  
12:19 <DarkKnightCZ> mflorea: latest clean 7.1 build, create panel with {{documentTree openTo="document:$doc.documentReference" root="space:xwiki:Sandbox" /}} , add it to left panel, open Sandbox (it's opened properly), open any of Sandbox test pages (tree is not opened)... there is quite easy "workaround", when you can use document:xwiki:Sandbox.WebHome as root entity, but that doesn't cover all usecases  
12:21 <mflorea> http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Document+Tree+Macro  
12:21 <mflorea> I see that showSpaces is false by default. How do you expect the root to be a space when the tree doesn't show spaces?  
12:22 <mflorea> the root must be a node that the tree normally displays. i.e. consider the tree without the root parameter, see what nodes are displayed, use one of those nodes as root  
12:23 <mflorea> if the tree doesn't show spaces without the root parameter then there's no point in setting the root to a space  
12:24 <mflorea> the root is used to display a subtree of the tree displayed without the root parameter  
12:26 <DarkKnightCZ> hmm, i wonder how did i miss it  
12:26 <DarkKnightCZ> thanks
